messages.message: uh before we say yes we need to make sure we want to commit to _always having it there_ and not being able to upgrade the version unless we coordinate with them :slightly_smiling_face: <- likely warrants more discussion?
there was a long email chain a while back @Kerry @Aaron Vontell (https://groups.google.com/a/instabase.com/forum/#!search/openpyxl/eng/ripxN4ko6Bk/zqL3i0j8CAAJ)
I believe NLTK has always been included and is relied on by a lot of customers for sentence tokenization, so we def need to support it at this point
is infra aware of these dependencies and has it documented? @Aaron Vontell @shaunak @Heymian
Looks documented, see link in david’s next message?
oh i mean we should prolly add nltk to the list of we want to support
thought you mean “do we have a place where it documented”
@Chetan @dlluncor for reference I think nltk has been included forever, it was probably just missed whenever that list was constructed

Yes it has been included. However, the libraries we provide in app-tasks we don’t try to let the customers know that all of them are available. The idea is that they should be depending on as few of them as possible. So if we want to add them to the permanent list, we should be as strict as possible.

@Aaron Vontell — could you help update the list to the permanent list of libraries we plan to support in app-tasks for the customer to know about (note: this is different than all the possible libraries which are actually available in app-tasks)
I see :joy: yes I can create a list of the few that should be mentioned. Who should I send that list to?
oh you can just create a PR for it — you can add me as a reviewer if you want — it requires updating the rst file
